New Records: That's the third quickest goal in the history of the European Championship.
Key Match Events: De Bruyne scored a toe-poked, first-time finish after a flick on from a long ball.
Doku was free at the back post but De Bruyne put just too much on it and it slid past Doku.
Lukaku fed De Bruyne in acres on the left but De Bruyne's pass was too much and it slid past Doku.
VAR confirmed De Bruyne's goal was not offside.
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium asserted their credentials at Euro 2024 with a 2-0 victory over Romania.

After the shock of a defeat to Slovakia in their opening match, it looked like they might meekly depart the international stage at an early juncture once more. In Cologne they fired back with a vibrant performance in one of the most entertaining matches of the tournament.
It is a foothold at Euro 2024 for them, and perhaps a base camp for one final yahoo at a major trophy for their thirtysomething stars.
Jan Vertonghen slotted into defence effortlessly, while De Bruyne turned in the kind of performance we see on a regular basis for Manchester City.
If their record scorer Romelu Lukaku can stay just the right side of the offside line and turn his personal fortunes around, they can still be a handful.
Miscellaneous Highlights: All three teams in Group E are now on three points ahead of the final fixtures.

Belgium came flying out of the traps and won the ball high, with Doku finding Lukaku to feet in the area. Lukaku touched it off to Tielemans on the edge, who crashed a low drive past Nita. That's a beauty of a goal.
Romania's Dennis Man had Romania's best chance in the second half, which was smothered by Koen Casteels.
